summary: This document is a formal revocation of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust, executed by Jeffrey Epstein as Grantor and acknowledged by the three trustees. It references the original trust agreement and its first amendment, and the revocation is dated January 30, 2017, which is notable as it occurred after his 2008 conviction and before his 2019 arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: He is the individual who created and is now revoking the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust, signing the revocation document.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: He is listed as one of the three trustees of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust and acknowledges receipt of the revocation.

events.title: Amendment and Restatement of 2014 Trust
events.description: The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust was amended and restated, involving Epstein and the three trustees.

events.title: First Amendment to Trust Signed by Grantor
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed the First Amendment to the Amendment and Restatement of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust.

events.title: Revocation of Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein formally revoked the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust in its entirety, with the revocation acknowledged by the trustees.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein revoked his 'Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust' in its entirety on January 30, 2017.
The trust had three trustees: Darren K. Indyke, James E. Staley, and David Mitchell.
The trust was originally amended and restated on May 1, 2015, and further amended by a First Amendment signed by Epstein on September 1, 2015.
The trustees acknowledged the revocation, though their acknowledgment dates on the document are not filled in.
The revocation was notarized in New York County, New York.
